dialogues.text: We gotta get help.  Aw, fuck!  Damn.
Well, then, how about a cup of coffee, Darlene?
I assume you want that to go.
Uh, you wanna hunt outta season, it's cool with me.  But mostly, well, they just take a six...
...and a rifle.  You, on the other hand...
...look like you're after something more dangerous.
Actually, I was just looking for a restroom.
Doc Long.  Yeah, I know him.  Weirdo guy. He comes in from...
Contrary to what Dr. Long may have told you, this is neither...
...your concern nor your fight.  Relinquish the package and you can go.
I don't know what the hell...
I want you to look at one another...
...and ask a simple question -   Are you actually prepared...
Because if you don't give me that cylinder, your lives will end...
And I can't guarantee the end will be quick.
Elvis is fuckin' dead, man.  Get yourself some CDs.
I got someone who's anxious to talk to you, Mr. Mason.
Then meet me at the dam in fifteen minutes.
You try anything, it goes in...
It's a little late for matinee heroics, Mason.  Just give me the con-...
Why?  You're a nothing, nobody!  Why?
They took that life away and left me with nothing.
This river ends at a hydro dam...
...in Missoula.  All we need to do is get to Mason before anyone else does.
Carl, Dennis, get out of sight.
Officer Pappas, I'm glad you're here.
Mind if you tell me what's goin' on?
I'm Colonel Brynner, U.S. Special Operations Com-...
We were called in by the Jerome base...
...to pursue a man who's stolen government proper-...
Yeah, he's wanted in connection with a death this morning at the Jerome...
Long went missing from the Tech Center this morning along with a very dangerous...
Mason, you have to take this...
Wait.  This town is full of trucks.  Nice new trucks.  You don't need to go...
So you called the damned thing Elvis
I had no idea how powerful it was.
Eighteen men were k- killed in sec-...
...-onds...with just a fraction of what's in...
...about the man who did this, he's-he's comin' after it.
...have it.  You have to...have to get it to M...to McGruder.
So, Mason, last Wednesday night, uh...were you out...
...uh, drifting around like the trash you are, or were you here workin'?
If it was Wednesday night, I was workin'.
Do you recognize this young man?
...badge someday, then you can ask the questions.  Until then...
...selling this young man beer Wednesday night.
I don't sell beer to minors.  I take that kinda thing...
Mason, you wouldn't know the truth if it bit you.  We've got your whole record.  We know about the-the conviction for vagrancy...
I didn't sell the boy any...
Shut your mouth until I tell you...
You know, I gotta tell you.  That really bothers me, somebody calls me "son."
Then how about if I call you "ass-...
I said let me see your hands now!
You redneck idiot, do you have...
Yeah, asshole.  I'm puttin' a murder suspect and a guy who...
...on the other end of this phone.
His name's Vitelli.  Talk to him.  He's right out-...
Wait.  Listen to me, Pappas.  If you don't let us by...
This was supposed to be a...
You have ten percent of a hundred million dollars comin' your way.  I think we can impose on you for a little overtime.
Sir, all potential customers have been informed of the delay.  Fur-...
No.  A pair of average citizens have decided to risk their lives for their country.  I almost remember what that feels like.
You can't fire on them.  You're gonna detonate the crystals.
Just when we have all the cards, Vaughn.  Take these two behind the van.
We're gonna use them for demonstration  footage.
Having witnessed the effects myself, I can assure you it'll be very useful when the bidding starts.
Get 'em in the  middle of the dam.
Stay put.  Keep the camera trained on...
Get 'em on line, then stall.  Long can't have gotten far.
Vaughn, Burke, move to the end of the street.  Fan out and work your way back to the motel.
There's nothing in here, sir.  They got away with it.
All right.  Let's clear the mess and move out.
Besides, how are we gonna sell something we don't have?

Nothing has changed, I assure you both. The Army still thinks we got Elvis.  They had a tactical withdrawal.  It's just those two amateurs now.  Do you really want to concede a hundred million dollars to them?
To tell you the truth, we're looking for a scientist who's gone missing from the Tech Center.  Maybe you know him. Richard Long.
Give it to me now, or you'll be dead...
Don't be tedious, waiter.  Dr. Long called it Elvis.
I got three thousand dollars of highly perishable ice cream products that taste bad enough when it's...
Just give me Elvis and I'll make sure you have enough money for a dozen ice cream trucks.
I don't ever wanna see another ice cream...
Your move.  Okay, Vaughn, you drive.
I urge you to be persuasive.
This country trained me to kill...
What the hell is all this about a detonation today?  We're scheduled...
I don't work for you, Captain Brynner.
Sweeney tells me you don't have computer confirmation?
You know, captain, if you hadn't spent so much of your career questioning your superiors, you might've found yourself with more gold leaf on your col-...
This isn't some kind of pissing contest, Long.  You may be in charge here, but those men out there are my responsi-...
Look, this is a scientific experiment, okay?
If it works, your stock at the Pentagon will go up along with mine.  I don't think I need to mention you could use the help.
The NSA thinks the UN is onto your work...
...here, and the White House is screaming about chemical weapons,  and we're...
...sittin' here with our hands in the goddamn cookie jar!  And let me tell you something else.  I didn't join the service to let people like you turn...
...the United States into the kind of country we're supposed to be fighting against.
But you have no choice but to follow orders.
Now, I know.  You have moral objections to what we're doing here, but believe...
...me, if I thought there was any real danger, I-I wouldn't go forward.
You have my word on that.
All right.  One more shot, provided...  we're off the island tonight.
Damn you, Long!  My people are out there! Your people are out there!
...I wish they would've let me say something...
There's nothing to say, doctor.  Someone had to take the fall, and they still need you, whereas...I've never been anything more than a thorn in their collective side, as you once said.
...not at all like a man responsible for the deaths of eighteen peo-...
Is that why you're here?  To blame...
...me?  Well, you could've saved yourself the trip.
I know where the  blame belongs.  But I didn't put you in prison, Andrew.  The government did...
Oh, I'm well aware of what the government did, I assure you.  Actually, I've just come to say how grateful I am to you...
Together, you gave me the opportunity to realize just how very wrong my life had gone.
Do you remember telling me once that all through my career, I'd never fit in?  Well...
...you were right, of course.  But after...
...years of thinking the matter over, I began to see that the whole thing wasn't really my problem.
What rational man could fit in with the sorts of things our government was doing? The sorts of things you've...
Do you think I haven't seen the bodies of those...
...men every time I've closed my eyes?  But after you went away, I--
All right.  After they put you away...
...I began trying to find ways of controlling the effects of the weapon that we tested on Horn Island.
And let me guess.  You failed.
Why is it you scientists can create implements of destruction...
It must've happened right after we left.
Missoula's reporting the refrigerator truck as a stolen vehicle.  I told you Mason was walking shit.
Pappas, that other guy was unloading ice cream into a freezer.  Now, what could he have to do with a military scientist, huh?
The sooner you get up the lab, the sooner you'll figure it out.
No, sir.  I've never seen this guy before.
Sure as hell have met a few assholes like that, though.
Well, why don't they talk to the sage of Jerome here?!
...the guy the Army guys are lookin' for!
Bullshit.  Put the phone down, Mason.
A little early for a delivery.
...yeah.  Tryin' to get most of my day done before it hits nine-...
Sam?  Andy gave Sam a nice big desk to park his fat ass behind.
Where do you want this stuff?
Hey, I'm with you on that one, my man. Prick.
Look, you need me to sign an invoice or somethin'?
Uh, between this month and last month, you owe four hundred and seventeen dollars.  And we need that in cash.
Yeah, well, Darlene didn't say anything about it to me, so tell Andy to bill her like usual and let them sort it out. Move.
Well, he told me to collect cash.
Hey, you and I are seein' eye to eye on a whole range of issues this mornin'.
Except for the fact that I need cash.
He could've.  That-That's true.  But that would've been smart...
...two things Andy is not.  Uh, but I tell you what.
Bein' that it's cash, I'm gonna give you ten percent...
...off.  Say, uh, three seventy-five. Seein' that we both have so much love...
...for Andy, I'll tell him I lost a few cartons comin' over  the mountain.
That'll make up the difference, huh?
Well, Darlene usually gives me a signed check for emergencies.  I could always give you that.
No, no, no, no, no, no. Wait.
Dude in uniform get in your face, you do not shoot your mouth off.
No, no, no.  You don't need my truck. You need somebody else's truck...
Look, if I don't get this stuff to McGruder, it's goodbye, Andy's Ice Cream, goodbye, Jerome, goodbye, Mon-...
Wait, wait.  You don't believe the dead guy, do...
Yeah, I believe him.  He was my friend.
Hey, listen!  Do you know what I think?  I...
...think he was a wacko.  And I think that G.I. ninja's a bigger wacko.  And I think you're the biggest wack-...
...-o of all, wantin' to be a part of this wacko shit!
You are seriously mistaken if you think you are going anywhere in my...
Then you drive me to McGrud-...
Look...I got two tons of the world's nastiest ice cream sittin' in a truck that should've been retired ten years ago.  That shit will be worthless by noon.
...is as dangerous as you seem to think it is, I'm gettin' my ass as far away from you and it as possible.
Wait, wait, wait.  Hold up.  Hold up.  Look.
I got fifty bucks.  I'll get more.
I'll rent the truck from you.  You can stay here, you can go.  Whatever you want.
All right, then how about this?
Hey, you're gonna piss me--  What the hell are you supposed to be...
You are not takin' my truck!
Look, put this in the back.  Keep it safe.
There we go.  There we go.  Did you keep it safe?  Did you
What the hell is with you, dog?  He's the one with the damn gun.
You gave him ice cream, didn't you?  Come on, let's go.
Yeah, to keep him off my ass.
What did you do that for?  It makes him mean as a snake.
That dog was mean before I met him.
Come on, get in the truck.
I'm gonna bust a mudhole in your ass. I'm gonna--  Don't tell me to shut-- It's none of your business.  Man, I can talk all I want to.
It happens to this piece of shit...
Do you wanna give me a minute?
Suppose you're gonna shoot me because you can't get service on my cell phone.
Billings?  No, no, no, no, no.  We need to go to McGruder.
No, you gotta go to McGrud-...
No, no, no, no, no.  We gotta go to McGruder!  I go where the truck goes!
To get to McGruder, you have to go through Missoula, and I ain't goin' to Missoula.
No way.  We're goin' through McGrud-...
Look...I kinda borrowed the truck from Andy.
I did not steal this truck!
...what all the bullshit about the cash was, wasn't it?!  You stole this truck, and now you're trying to sell...
I didn't steal the truck! He owed it to me!  Anyway, the important thing is I'm not goin' through Missoula!
Look, I don't give a shit if you go through Missoula at a hundred miles an hour.  We're goin' to McGruder.
I'm about to get in your ass like last year's underwear, man.
We can't push old Pete in this heat.  He can't take it.
Ah, one of them's in the back.
No, no, no, no, no.  Keep goin'.
You mean to tell me you hijacked me with an empty gun?!
Get him to stand up, Night Shift.
Don't gimme that "nice job" shit, man! They still got a vanload comin', and what do you got besides an empty...
Probably because they know a psycho when they hear one.
Hey, take a look at your situation and...
...reconsider that statement there, Night Shift.  You're psy-...
Every time I look at you, I wanna hit...
And I'm a peaceful man, and...
...you stole the truck to uphold your principles, right?
I did not steal the truck.
It was owed to me.  You stole the damn...
Shut up, shut up!  It's beeping.
Well, then, that means it's call...
You  snatch that  phone  from me one more time, I'm--
You can just bend over and kiss your crazy ass goodbye, buddy!
You think we can make what?!  You see that truck?!
Eight and a half feet wide!  Weighs over five tons!
Hey, and what if we  don't make it?!
Your weedkiller on steroids goes down with us!  Everybody  dies!
I don't think we have much of a choice...
Oh, Petey.  Oh, Petey.  Oh, please, Pete.  Please don't do this to me.  Okay.
I should've had that dog bite me.  I would've gotten rabies! Could've went to the hospital, had a pretty nurse!
Go, go, go, go, go.  Oh, shit.
I'm goin'.  I'm goin', baby.  I'm goin', I'm goin'.
...-hood of you knowin' any prayers is slim...
All right, you got it, you got it!
What are you talkin' about?!  I'm the one drivin'!
Oh, Pete.  Oh, shit!  Oh, shit!
Gimme that, gimme that, gimme that.
Hey, put it back!  We're takin' off.
You're not dangerous!  You're crazy!  I ain't gettin' in this damn thing!
I don't want you to come anyway.
This thing just went up a degree.  Ice cream's not workin'.
This river's fed by a glacier.  Willing to bet my life that it's a good deal under fifty degrees.
Hey, you didn't happen to lock the truck up when you got out...
See, now why would you do that to a man in my posi-...
Hey, I didn't steal the truck.  You...
Hey, I told you I did not steal that truck.  Andy owes me a lot more than that four-wheeled...
It won't even start half the time.
I deserve a lot more than that truck! Ten years, ten years I busted my ass for that fat rat bastard.
And he swore, he swore once I got a degree...
...there'd be a sales rep desk with my name on it.  But every time something opened up, there'd be some idiot cousin...
...or nephew or some good old boy...
...just ready to just slide him right in there.  And what about me, huh?  What about Arlo, huh?  What about my needs? You know, I got a-I got student loans...
Nobody's lookin' out for my interests.  My credit was fucked!  And then when he promoted Sam over me, I just snapped.  So I split.
So I took his truck, yeah.
You know, four years ago, I was a split end at Kentucky State.
Started every game my senior year.  Not all-American or anything, but not bad. Anyway, the real star was my best friend, the quarterback.  Got taken in the first round.
I remember him.  Got in a car crash or somethin'.
We were celebrating right after the draft, going from bar to bar.  I was drivin'.
And I put the car into a ditch.  He spent eighteen weeks in the...
Never gonna throw a ball in the pros.
Couldn't deal with it.  So I split.
And  things sort of just went downhill from there.
Anyway, about ten months ago, I wound up in Jerome, workin' for Darlene.
Well, shit.  Could be worse.  I mean, we're both up shit's creek, but at least we have a paddle.
...for whatever it's worth, I'm sorry I dragged you into this...
To tell you the truth, you didn't.
I mean, if that gun was...
...loaded, I didn't buy you as a shoot- ...
...Long.  Somethin' about that look in his eye when he talked about that Elvis...
Well, all the same.  If we get to Missoula, help me find a car.  I'd appreciate it.  Then...you can...
Like I said, I got a pretty good idea of what's at stake here.
All right, all right.  Hey, hey.
I think you oughta cut a...
Even though it is nice to see Andy...
...squirm, I don't want his brains all over my shirt...
Bullshit.  You would've killed us anyway.
Put your hand in my pants.
We're gonna die, and you want me to do some freaky shit like that?!
You just can't leave that stuff with that lu-...
That's why I didn't give it...
Aw, shit.  Would you be more care-...
What do you think I'm doin'?!
Can we get out on your end of the tunnel?
Well, hell, the smoke's gonna kill us anyway!
Got it?   Come on, darlin'.  I gotcha.
Arlo, I'm gonna get Elvis.  You go.
They'll meet you at the top.
Elvis is still in there!  It's gonna go off!
You know, we saved half a million people from a full-body peel.
They aren't exactly gonna publicize this,  Arlo.
Hey-Hey-Hey-Hey-Hey.  We are heroes, my man.  It's time to start actin' like it.
Excuse me.  I got a bullet in my leg.
Who had to put a gun to your head?
Who put the big hurt on...
...that Army nut job to save your narrow butt?
Right.  You damn skippy.  And now that I am both jobless...
...and-and-and truckless in the service of my country...
...I feel that my government owes me a little restitution.
I'll handle this from here, sweet   Owes us a little restitution.
What about all that "no need to get in the man's...
I was not in the man's face.  I was nego-...
Look.  That's negotiating? He threatened to kill...
But he didn't.  See, that's negotiation.
Bullshit, yeah.  Well...if we're not gonna be famous, at least this'll be a great story to tell some ladies in a bar or somethin'.
You know, it's, uh-it's very hush-hush, as we say in the spy game.
It all started with our mission in Istanbul.
I was undercover as a tennis player.
My code name was Blackjack.  Night Shift was my coach.  Uh-Uh-Uh, I'm sorry. Mason was my coach.
Uh, he handled rackets, and I carried the balls.
you see, that was a-that was my mission.
Been trying to figure out your secret.
Yeah.  Ten months we've been fishin' this river together.  We use the same equipment, more or less...
...but you pull twice as many fish out of the water as I do.
And I'm good at this.  Been doing it since I was a kid.  But you, I don't know.  Somehow you think...
No, that's not possible, Mason.  The trout...
How can we ever hope to win against the trout?
There's only one way you can do it, Mason.
Turn the power of the hunter against him.
...create a piece of bait that sends the fish's instincts into overdrive...
...forcing him to strike.  And only then does our noble friend realize that the prey...can bite...
Some people might say you're readin' an awful lot in-...
The compound has to be kept cold...
Never let it reach fifty degre-degrees.
You're the only one I can trust.
The only one who understands what this me-...
Tryin' to remember somethin' somebody once told me about tyin' a fly.
And only then does our noble friend realize...
Well,  Costello's finished with the stability profile, but Abbott is still chewing on the load file.
So reaction temperature is fifty degrees.
Well, your prediction was on the nose.
How much longer for the range and power projections?
I don't know.  Um, he's working, but there's a lot of data. Maybe...another hour?
We don't have an hour.  We're already supposed to be shut down.
I got eight thousand yards. Radius is five...
Oh, caught a few, lost a few.
Story of my life.  Well, one thing you won't lose is that friend of yours back there, I'll tell you that.
Oh, you're two of a kind, doc.  Oh, he may not have your sheepskins, and...
...well, most of the time he looks like something the cat might have dragged in, but, you know...
Uh, we both like to fish.
His I know.  Yours I don't have a clue.  But if it wasn't for you, I think he'd have drifted right on through this town.
You know, I have yet to get a simple cup of coffee and a meal in this place, Darlene.
And you ain't gonna start now.
...-son.  Of all the days for you to show up late.  First, the idiot April calls in sick.  Then I got a bad tooth...
...and then my night man shows up when he feels like...
Darlene, it's five-thirty.  Now, I worked late for you this mornin', and you didn't wanna spring for over-...
Oh.  Well, I have got to get to the dentist be-...
...-fore he closes, which means you're gonna have to cover the grill and the floor.
Mm.  It doesn't take a genius.
And don't give him any ice cream...
...like April.  It gives him gas. And make sure there's  two pots of coffee...
...ready before the morning crowd blows in.
...ready before the morning crowd blows in.  I got it...
